newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks press lower as tech stocks slump.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks press lower as tech stocks slump.

text.p: Wall Street stocks slipped to new session lows on Monday as a weak technology sector dragged the major indices lower.
The Dow industrials fell 45 points to 6659. Losing issues led gainers by a three-to-two margin on NYSE volume of about 275 million shares.
The Nasdaq Composite fell 12 points to 1210, just a trace higher than the index stood during the broad market selloff prior to last week.

"Tech stocks participated in the rally last week for about 15 minutes," said Scott Bleier, chief investment strategist at Prime Charter Ltd. "Most indices haven't made anywhere near the progress the Dow has."
International Business Machines Corp shed 2-1/8 to 137-5/8 and Cisco Systems Inc fell one to 47-3/8. Microsoft Corp bucked the trend, up one at 108-5/8.
"All the money is going to Microsoft, the anointed leader and the one company that never disappoints," Bleier said.
Shortly after bottoming at 6659, the Dow recouped some losses to stand at 6665, down 38 points for the day.
